summary: Email chain between Florence Hutner, General Counsel for the NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), and an unidentified federal prosecutor (likely from USAO-SDNY) regarding redactions to the OCME report on Jeffrey Epstein's death. The prosecutor requests withholding of scene photos, 360 scans, and certain information, citing an ongoing federal investigation.

persons.name: Florence Hutner
persons.role: General Counsel, Office of Chief Medical Examiner (NYC)
persons.context: Correspondent representing OCME in discussions with federal prosecutors about redacting the Epstein autopsy report and related materials. She seeks clarification on the scope and duration of redactions.

persons.name: Rebekah
persons.context: Correspondent from the U.S. Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) requesting redactions to the OCME Epstein file, including scene photos and 360 scans, to protect an ongoing criminal investigation.

connections.description: Professional correspondence regarding legal coordination on redacting the Epstein OCME report between OCME's General Counsel and a federal prosecutor.

events.title: Initial Redaction Request
events.description: Federal prosecutor (Rebekah) sends initial secure message to Florence Hutner requesting redactions to the Epstein OCME file.

events.title: OCME Seeks Clarification on Redactions
events.description: Florence Hutner responds, seeking clarification on whether redactions include OCME's 360 scan, whether they are temporary or permanent, and noting OCME's obligation to comply with court orders.

events.title: Prosecutor Confirms Redaction Scope
events.description: Rebekah confirms the 360 scan and scene photos should be withheld, states redactions are not intended to be permanent, and mentions a separate issue regarding an MCC voicemail.

events.title: Revised Report Provided
events.description: Prosecutor sends a revised OCME report with one redaction removed per OCME's request and asks OCME to notify recipients that redactions are at USAO-SDNY's request due to an ongoing investigation.

locations: 421 E. 26th Street, New York, NY 10016 (Office of Chief Medical Examiner)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) requested redactions to the NYC OCME's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death to protect an ongoing federal criminal investigation.
Requested redactions included scene photographs and a 360-degree scan taken by OCME, indicating these materials were considered sensitive to the investigation.
The federal prosecutor clarified the redactions were not intended to be permanent, only for the duration of the investigation.
OCME noted it would comply with court orders if subpoenaed for the unredacted file but would notify prosecutors to allow them to seek to preserve investigative confidentiality.
A voicemail from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) was mentioned as a separate point of coordination between OCME and prosecutors.
